etymology.description: pictogram (象形): coiled snake; an alternate theory analyzes it as a foetus; graph similar to 已.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a coiled serpent, which aligns with its use as the sixth Earthly Branch associated with the Snake. Its visual similarity to 已/己 has led to historical confusion and variant explanations of the graph.

examples.chinese: 现在是巳时(現在是巳時)。
examples.english: It is the Si hour (9–11 a.m.).

examples.chinese: 他属蛇，对应的地支是巳(他屬蛇，對應的地支是巳)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shǔ shé, duìyìng de dìzhī shì sì.
examples.english: He is of the Snake sign; the corresponding Earthly Branch is Si.

examples.chinese: 农历常用十二地支记时，其中之一是巳(農曆常用十二地支記時，其中之一是巳)。
examples.pinyin: Nónglì cháng yòng shí’èr dìzhī jì shí, qízhōng zhī yī shì sì.
examples.english: The lunar calendar often uses the twelve Earthly Branches to mark hours; one of them is Si.
